pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:0.5_0: The training rule on defecating on the same seat
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were defecating and urinating while standing. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:1.3.1_0: “‘When not sick, I will not defecate or urinate while standing,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:1.4_0: If one is not sick, one should not defecate or urinate while standing.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:1.5_0: If, out of disrespect, a monk who is not sick defecates or urinates while standing, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:1.7.1_0: or it has not been trusted ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:1.9_0: The rule, the training rule on bartering, is finished.
